Detailed Description

Enables querying and constrolling how screens and/or pages are laid out.

Definition at line 1096 of file Readium.idl.

Member Function Documentation

DOMstring PageLayout::getGutterWidth ( )

Returns the gutter distance between synthetic spread pages

Note: If there is no synthetic spread the returned string will be empty.

Returns
the width of the gutter in CSS units
integer PageLayout::getLayoutWidth ( )

Returns the current width of the display surface (in pixels) available to layout screens (pages), including margins and gutters.

Returns
integer
DOMString PageLayout::getMargins ( )

Get the margins setting for the current document.

Note: Will be empty for fixed-layout documents

Returns
the margins string in CSS fashion (all, or top, right, bottom, left)
integer PageLayout::getRenditionFlow ( )

Returns the document-level rendition flow mode

Note: If the document is fixed layout this will always return REND_FLOW_FIXED, indicating that the document is fixed layout

Returns
the constant that is the current rendition flow state
integer PageLayout::getRenditionLayout ( )

Returns the current document-level rendition layout parameter

Returns
an integer constant that indicates paginated or reflowable
integer PageLayout::getRenditionOrientation ( )

Returns the document-level rendition orientation

Returns
the current rendition-orientation setting (see constants above)
integer PageLayout::getRenditionSpread ( )

Return the document-level rendition:spread property or setting

Returns
integer
boolean PageLayout::setGutterWidth ( DOMString  width)

Sets the gutter width between synthetic spread pages

Note: Will fail if the document or reading system does not allow synthetic spreads

Parameters
widthwidth of the gutter in CSS units
Returns
true if successful else false
boolean PageLayout::setLayoutWidth ( integer  width)

Set the width (in pixels) of the display available for layout of the screens (pages). This is the width of the displays available to layout spreads, including the margins and gutter width, if any.

Note: This may not be supported on some devices

Parameters
widththe width in pixels
Returns
false if request not supported
boolean PageLayout::setMargins ( DOMstring  margins)

Set the margins for the current document.

Note: Will return false for fixed-layout documents

Parameters
marginsdesired margins in CSS syntax (all, or top, right, bottom, left)
Returns
true if successful false if ignored or not supported
boolean PageLayout::setRenditionFlow ( integer  mode)

Set the renditiion flow mode for the document

Note: If the document is not reflowable the method will return false

Parameters
modethe desired rendition flow mode (see constants above)
Returns
true if not ignored else false
boolean PageLayout::setRenditionOrientation ( integer  orient)

Set the rendition orientation property for the current document

Note: The reading system may ignore this setting, in which case the return value is false.

Parameters
orientthe desired orientation (see constants above)
Returns
true if not ignored else false
boolean PageLayout::setRenditionSpread ( integer  spread)

Set the layout mode for the current screen(s)

Note: This may fail if the document is set to Spread:None

Parameters
spreadthe current layout mode (see constants above)
